discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
SSH Events in Host Observations log relevant events related to SSH connections, such as:
User: Who connected.
Process path: What processes were started as a result of the SSH session.
Command: What commands the user executed during the SSH session.
Startup process is not an option. SSH Events focus on specific actions performed by users accessing the host via SSH, not on system startup processes.

Selected Answer: BDE
D --> Alert/prevent processes by path
E --> The SSH events tab shows ssh commands run in interactive sessions, limited to 100 events per hour.
B --> Detect binaries created by a user without a package manager

questions.question_text: Which two variables must be modified to achieve automatic remediation for identity and access management (IAM) alerts in Azure cloud? (Choose two.)

An administrator has added a Cloud account on Prisma Cloud and then deleted it.

What will happen if the deleted account is added back on Prisma Cloud within a 24-hour period?

choices.D: Existing alerts will be marked as resolved.
choices.B: Existing alerts will be displayed again.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
If you add the account back on Prisma Cloud within a 24-hour period, the existing alerts will display again. After 24 hours, the alerts are resolved with the resolution reason Account Deleted and then permanently deleted.

choices.B: Authenticate with Prisma Cloud registry, and then pull the images from the Prisma Cloud registry.
choices.A: Pull the images from the Prisma Cloud registry without any authentication.
choices.C: Retrieve Prisma Cloud images using URL auth by embedding an access token.
choices.D: Download Prisma Cloud images from github.paloaltonetworks.com.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B --> Get the Prisma Cloud Console Images with Basic Authorization
C --> Get the Prisma Cloud Console Images with URL Authorization

questions.question_text: In which two ways can Prisma Cloud images be retrieved in Prisma Cloud Compute Self-Hosted Edition? (Choose two.)

choices.B: It detects unusual server port activity or unusual protocol activity from a client within or outside the cloud environment.
choices.A: It detects the activity caused by the spambot.
choices.D: It detects potential creation of an unauthorized network of compute instances either accidentally or for cryptojacking.
choices.C: It detects potential creation of an unauthorized network of compute instances with AutoFocus.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D --> the Anomalous compute provisioning activity policy is not enabled by default. When enabled, this policy detects potential creation of an unauthorized network of compute instances either accidentally or for cryptojacking.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-policies/anomaly-policies
